snippet: Apple has changed its mind about not participating in a government-backed rating system that assesses the environmental friendliness of electronic products. Bob Mansfield, the outgoing senior vice president of hardware engineering at Apple, posted a...
abstract: Apple has changed its mind about not participating in a government-backed rating system that assesses the environmental friendliness of electronic products. Bob Mansfield, the outgoing senior vice president of hardware engineering at Apple, posted a letter saying that the company had heard from many customers who were troubled by the move.

headline.main: Apple Backtracks on Withdrawal From Environmental Ratings
